trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a new file or replaces a file.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a new file or replaces a file.

trans-unit.source: Note that calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> only initializes the file.
trans-unit.target: Note that calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> only initializes the file.

trans-unit.source: To add content to a file, call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Range</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.
trans-unit.target: To add content to a file, call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Range</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:
trans-unit.target: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:

trans-unit.source: The name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: The name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: The name of your file share.
trans-unit.target: The name of your file share.

trans-unit.source: The path to the directory where the file is to be created.
trans-unit.target: The path to the directory where the file is to be created.

trans-unit.source: If the directory path is omitted, the file will be created within the specified share.
trans-unit.target: If the directory path is omitted, the file will be created within the specified share.

trans-unit.source: If specified, the directory must already exist within the share before the file can be created.
trans-unit.target: If specified, the directory must already exist within the share before the file can be created.

trans-unit.source: The name of the file to create.
trans-unit.target: The name of the file to create.

trans-unit.source: For details on path naming restrictions, see <link xlink:href="f38d4c69-cb50-4ef3-a8a3-276341689769" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details on path naming restrictions, see <link xlink:href="f38d4c69-cb50-4ef3-a8a3-276341689769" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="2ea86972-4df0-4b87-97fd-3c88910c15e0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="2ea86972-4df0-4b87-97fd-3c88910c15e0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time for the request.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the File, Blob, Queue, and Table services in Azure</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the File, Blob, Queue, and Table services in Azure</link>.

trans-unit.source: This header specifies the maximum size for the file, up to 1 TB.
trans-unit.target: This header specifies the maximum size for the file, up to 1 TB.

trans-unit.source: The MIME content type of the file.
trans-unit.target: The MIME content type of the file.

trans-unit.source: Specifies which content encodings have been applied to the file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies which content encodings have been applied to the file.

trans-unit.source: This value is returned to the client when the <link xlink:href="317b7eb6-7791-4007-9175-846b456f897c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get File</link> operation is performed on the file resource and can be used to decode file content.
trans-unit.target: This value is returned to the client when the <link xlink:href="317b7eb6-7791-4007-9175-846b456f897c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get File</link> operation is performed on the file resource and can be used to decode file content.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the natural languages used by this resource.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the natural languages used by this resource.

trans-unit.source: The File service stores this value but does not use or modify it.
trans-unit.target: The File service stores this value but does not use or modify it.

trans-unit.source: Name-value pairs associated with the file as metadata.
trans-unit.target: Name-value pairs associated with the file as metadata.

trans-unit.source: Metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Note that file metadata specified via the File service is not accessible from an SMB client.
trans-unit.target: Note that file metadata specified via the File service is not accessible from an SMB client.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The ETag contains a value which represents the version of the file, in quotes.
trans-unit.target: The ETag contains a value which represents the version of the file, in quotes.

trans-unit.source: Returns the date and time the share was last modified.
trans-unit.target: Returns the date and time the share was last modified.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Any operation that modifies the directory or its properties updates the last modified time.
trans-unit.target: Any operation that modifies the directory or its properties updates the last modified time.

trans-unit.source: Operations on files do not affect the last modified time of the directory.
trans-unit.target: Operations on files do not affect the last modified time of the directory.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: To create a new file, first initialize the file by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and specify its maximum size, up to 1 TB.
trans-unit.target: To create a new file, first initialize the file by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Create File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> and specify its maximum size, up to 1 TB.

trans-unit.source: When performing this operation, do not include content in the request body.
trans-unit.target: When performing this operation, do not include content in the request body.

trans-unit.source: Once the file has been created, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Range</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to add content to the file or to modify it.
trans-unit.target: Once the file has been created, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Range</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to add content to the file or to modify it.

trans-unit.source: You can change the size of the file by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set File Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: You can change the size of the file by calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set File Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: If the share or parent directory does not exist, then the operation fails with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the share or parent directory does not exist, then the operation fails with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Note that the file properties <parameterReference>cache-control</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-md5</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-encoding</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>content-language</parameterReference> are discrete from the file system properties available to SMB clients.
trans-unit.target: Note that the file properties <parameterReference>cache-control</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-md5</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-encoding</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>content-language</parameterReference> are discrete from the file system properties available to SMB clients.

trans-unit.source: SMB clients are not able to read, write or modify these property values.
trans-unit.target: SMB clients are not able to read, write or modify these property values.
